snippet: The National Republican Campaign Committee customarily supports all Republican candidates for re-election, providing big-name guest speakers, holding fund-raisers, getting out the vote. But Representative Jay C. Kim of California's 41st Congressio...
lead_paragraph: The National Republican Campaign Committee customarily supports all Republican candidates for re-election, providing big-name guest speakers, holding fund-raisers, getting out the vote. But Representative Jay C. Kim of California's 41st Congressional District, east of Los Angeles, will get none of that help this year. Mr. Kim, the first Korean-American ever elected to Congress, has been considered a liability by his party ever since he pleaded guilty last year to accepting $230,000 in illegal campaign contributions.
abstract: National Republican Campaign Committee votes to remain neutral in California's 41st Congressional District primary; Rep Jay C Kim, first Korean-American ever elected to Congress, has been considered liability by his party ever since he pleaded guilty last year to accepting $230,000 in illegal campaign contributions (S)

headline.main: Political Briefing; To His Own Party, Persona Non Grata
